body.p:
To his Excellency B MaGoffin
Governor of Kentucky --

Your Petitioner Thomas Craycraft would respectfully represent that H C Miller being indicted in the Nelson Circuit for wounding one Bryant Shumate and required to give bail for his appearance in $1000 Your petitioner became his bond -- that the case being called at the Oct term 1861 and Miller not appearing the bond was forfeited and a summons thereon awarded which was executed on your petition but not on Miller and returned for trial of the April term 1862.

He and Miller both lived in Washington county but about 14 miles apart He knew Miller had not absconded and believed the summons executed on him and that he would attend and defend the summons and afterwards learned with surprise that he had not and that judgement for the $1000 had gone against your petitioner alone which he had since been compelled to replevy -- Miller is still at his home in Washington County He has ascertained and now states that when said forfeiture was made Miller was at home confined to bed by sickness and therefore unavoidably -- absent and could have easily made that fact appear so as to prevent the
judgment if said summons had been served upon him -- Owing to the distance of your petitioners residence from Millers he did not learn of ^him^ having been sick when the forfeiture occured until after the termime of which judgement was rendered against him and he was moreover by the facts he has stated from making inquiry or defence till it was too late to do so --
Whereupon he prays a remission of said judgment --
Sworn to by Thomas Craycraft before me -- June 16 1862 --
W R Casey J P W C

The undersigned citizens of Washington county, believeing the facts true as stated in the foregoing petition and that the case is one which appeals to the clemency of the Executive unite in the prayer for a remission of the judgments -- June 16 1862
